comment._content: See also:

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This is the Woman's Political Union's Suffrage Van. The following from the New York Tribune of June 20, 1915: An Old Favorite Amended to Date. (A boy threw a dead mouse into the roving van of the Woman's Polltical Union the other day, Miss Usher, who was speaking at the time, picked it up by the tail and gave it back to him.) One dead mouse; Nobody runs. 'Twas thrown one day in a suffrage van By a very old-fashioned and rude young man, One dead mouse. chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1915-06-20/ed-...
